item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6324-6336; text as passed Senate: CR S6324; text of measure as introduced: CR S6363)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S6324-6336; text as passed Senate: CR S6324; text of measure as introduced: CR S6363)

summary.text:
Expresses the Senate's eternal appreciation for veterans of the U.S. Armed Forces who fought to protect the United States and to preserve freedom and the U.S. way of life during World War II.

Honors the men and women who made the ultimate sacrifice and gave their lives during that global conflict.

Commends the 108 former members and six current members of the Senate who are veterans of World War II.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Expresses the Senate's eternal appreciation for veterans of the U.S. Armed Forces who fought to protect the United States and to preserve freedom and the U.S. way of life during World War II.

Honors the men and women who made the ultimate sacrifice and gave their lives during that global conflict.

Commends the 108 former members and six current members of the Senate who are veterans of World War II, including Senator Akaka, Senator Hollings, Senator Inouye, Senator Lautenberg, Senator Stevens, and Senator Warner.

bill.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate in honoring the service of the men and women who served in the Armed Forces of the United States during World War II.

item.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate in honoring the service of the men and women who served in the Armed Forces of the United States during World War II.
A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate in honoring the service of the men and women who served in the Armed Forces of the United States during World War II.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
